page.title: 07The Ecology round Alverton
page.content: The ecology of the area includes quite a bit of water based habitat.There is 1 main river running through which is called the Smite and is well stocked with freshwater fish which inturn attracts birds like kingfisher,heron, coots,moorhen and wildfowl.A disused quarry now flooded also attracts a variety of birds such as geese,grebes, ducks,snipe,curlew and sanderlings.The area is also rich in with meadow and woodland birds as well as mammals such as squirrel,fox,rodents,rabbits and occasional badger.The climate is moderate in rainfall and warmth which is ideal for the many cereal crops grown in the area.There are many streams and footpaths which cover the area but recently large areas of hedgerow have been removed especially at Flawborough which has made the farmland open and bare looking.
